conversation.content: I wanted a real Kobe jersey for my sick nephew, and you sent a generic one then posted lies about me when I called it out.

Look, the listing clearly stated it was a generic replica Lakers Championship jersey, not a specific player jersey, and I shipped exactly what was advertised - all sales are final as my policy states.
Your site specifically advertised it as a Kobe Bryant jersey before you changed it, and your false review calling me a "fraud" is damaging my reputation.

I never changed any listing, and I have screenshots to prove it was always listed as a generic championship jersey - I only posted that review to warn other sellers after you falsely called me a "LIAR AND A CROOK" in your review.
I need you to remove your false review about me and apologize - it's hurting my reputation on the platform where I've always maintained excellent standing.
I might consider removing my review if you remove yours first and apologize for falsely claiming I'm a "LIAR AND A CROOK" when I simply sold exactly what was advertised.
I'm willing to soften my review's language, but I need you to apologize publicly for your false claims about me and remove your harmful review first.

I value my reputation too, so here's what I can offer - I'll remove my review if you completely remove yours and post an apology for the false accusations, but I won't be issuing any refund for a correctly advertised product.
Your apology is more important to me than a refund - I'll remove my review if you both remove yours and post a public apology acknowledging your mistake.

I'll meet you halfway - I can remove my review and apologize for the tone, but not for the content since I stand by my experience, and in return, I need you to completely remove your review and apologize for calling me a "LIAR AND A CROOK."
I can accept removing my review completely if you fully apologize for both tone and content in your public statement - the apology is what matters most to me at this point.

Listen, I'm willing to apologize for how I responded, but not admit to false advertising since the listing was always accurate - if you remove your review completely, I'll remove mine and issue this apology, but still no refund on a correctly advertised item.
I can agree to no refund as long as your apology clearly states you were mistaken about calling me names and acknowledges my character wasn't at fault.

I can apologize for using harsh language and acknowledge that I reacted emotionally, but I won't claim the listing was inaccurate - if you completely remove your review, I'll remove mine and post this clarified apology with no refund required.
That works for me - I'll completely remove my review if you remove yours and post that apology acknowledging your emotional reaction was unjustified.
